Header: Trump signs childhood cancer bill into law
Content: U.S. President Donald Trump signed a childhood cancer bill into law surrounded by several young patients and survivors of the disease. The Childhood Cancer Survivorship, Treatment, Access and Research Act is designed to expand opportunities for pediatric cancer research and improve the quality of life for survivors. After the signing ceremony, Trump remarked to reporters that preparations for next week’s summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un were “moving along very well.”
